intro: Marah inermis, commonly known as the smooth cucumber or desert melon, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other cucurbits like cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a elongated, fleshy berry that can be eaten when ripe, though it is often used for its seeds and medicinal properties. Marah inermis is well adapted to survive in harsh environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves.
